block.p: In the first scientific study of the monarch butterfly's most threatened habitat, researchers found evidence that a stretch of forest in the mountains of central Mexico, to which millions of the butterflies migrate from the United States each year, has been whittled down to remnants in a sea of development and deforestation. Researchers found that nearly half of what was intact forest 30 years ago has suffered partial to complete deforestation.
